bill_title: prohibit using a social security number for a driver's license number.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit using a social security number for a driver's license number. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 32-12-17 be amended to read as follows: 32-12-17. The Department of Commerce and Regulation shall, upon payment of the fee established by § 32-12-16, issue to every applicant qualifying therefor an operator's license. An operator's license may be issued to a minor at least sixteen years of age but less than eighteen years of age who has successfully passed all driver's license examination tests and completed the requirements of an instruction permit as provided in § 32-12-11, if the applicant has not been convicted of a traffic violation in the past six months, and if the applicant is not currently under suspension, revocation, or disqualification. The license shall bear thereon a distinguishing number assigned to the licensee, the full legal name or any name lawfully taken, date of birth, residence address, an indication if the licensee is a donor pursuant to chapter 34-26, an indication if the licensee as a living will pursuant to chapter 34-12D or a durable power of attorney for health care pursuant to chapter 59-7, a color photo and a brief description of the licensee, and the licensee's signature. The distinguishing number may not be the applicant's social security number. The department shall indicate upon each driver's license the general class of vehicles which the licensee may drive.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit using a social security number for a driver's license number. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 32-12-17 be amended to read as follows: 32-12-17. The Department of Commerce and Regulation shall, upon payment of the fee established by § 32-12-16, issue to every applicant qualifying therefor an operator's license. An operator's license may be issued to a minor at least sixteen years of age but less than eighteen years of age who has successfully passed all driver's license examination tests and completed the requirements of an instruction permit as provided in § 32-12-11, if the applicant has not been convicted of a traffic violation in the past six months, and if the applicant is not currently under suspension, revocation, or disqualification. The license shall bear thereon a distinguishing number assigned to the licensee, the full legal name or any name lawfully taken, date of birth, residence address, an indication if the licensee is a donor pursuant to chapter 34-26, an indication if the licensee as a living will pursuant to chapter 34-12D or a durable power of attorney for health care pursuant to chapter 59-7, a color photo and a brief description of the licensee, and the licensee's signature. The distinguishing number may not be the applicant's social security number. The department shall indicate upon each driver's license the general class of vehicles which the licensee may drive. Section 2. The effective date of this Act is January 1, 2000. BILL HISTORY 1/21/99 First read in Senate and referred to Transportation. S.J. 144 1/28/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/28/99 Transportation Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 7, NAYS 0. S.J. 228
